Search

Attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Pennsylvania

[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)

74 languages [Add topic](#) [Jump to content](#bodyContent)

[Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system")
: [40°51′25.3″N 79°58′15.6″W﻿ / ﻿40.857028°N 79.971000°W﻿ / 40.857028; -79.971000](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania&params=40_51_25.3_N_79_58_15.6_W_)

[![Page semi-protected](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/1b/Semi-protection-shackle.svg/20px-Semi-protection-shackle.svg.png)](/wiki/Wikipedia:Protection_policy#semi "This article is semi-protected until April 9, 2029 at 01:53 UTC.")

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

2024 shooting in Pennsylvania, U.S.

| Attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Pennsylvania |     |
| --- | --- |
| [![Close-up aerial view showing the Butler Farm Show Grounds (right) on the day of the rally with the building (left) that the shooter climbed on](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Butler_Farm_Show_Airport_Trump_Rally_2024_02_%28cropped%29.jpg/330px-Butler_Farm_Show_Airport_Trump_Rally_2024_02_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Butler_Farm_Show_Airport_Trump_Rally_2024_02_(cropped).jpg)<br><br>Butler Farm Show Grounds (right), 6:01 p.m. EDT, 10 minutes before the shooting |     |
| ![Map](https://maps.wikimedia.org/img/osm-intl,13,a,a,270x200.png?lang=en&domain=en.wikipedia.org&title=Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania&revid=1307929762&groups=_4c0d42de5c9f2d784b9049910af7b2272c43d3cc) |     |
| Location | Butler Farm Show Grounds in [Connoquenessing Twp.](/wiki/Connoquenessing_Township,_Butler_County,_Pennsylvania "Connoquenessing Township, Butler County, Pennsylvania")<br> / [Meridian](/wiki/Meridian,_Pennsylvania "Meridian, Pennsylvania")<br>, near Butler, Pennsylvania, U.S. |
| [Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system") | [40°51′25.3″N 79°58′15.6″W﻿ / ﻿40.857028°N 79.971000°W﻿ / 40.857028; -79.971000](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania&params=40_51_25.3_N_79_58_15.6_W_) |
| Date | July 13, 2024; 13 months ago (2024-07-13)  <br>6:11 p.m. Trump was taken to a hospital, treated, and released later that day.[\[2\]](#cite_note-The_New_York_Times-2024-3)
[\[14\]](#cite_note-15)
 He made his first public appearance after the shooting two days later at the [2024 Republican National Convention](/wiki/2024_Republican_National_Convention "2024 Republican National Convention")
 in [Milwaukee](/wiki/Milwaukee "Milwaukee")
, Wisconsin, wearing a bandage on his ear.[\[15\]](#cite_note-16)

The incident is regarded as the most significant security failure by the Secret Service since [the attempted assassination](/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Ronald_Reagan "Attempted assassination of Ronald Reagan")
 of President [Ronald Reagan](/wiki/Ronald_Reagan "Ronald Reagan")
 in 1981.[\[16\]](#cite_note-17)
[\[17\]](#cite_note-18)
 The [director of the Secret Service](/wiki/Director_of_the_Secret_Service "Director of the Secret Service")
, [Kimberly Cheatle](/wiki/Kimberly_Cheatle "Kimberly Cheatle")
, faced bipartisan calls for her resignation when she testified before the [United States House Committee on Oversight and Accountability](/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_Oversight_and_Accountability "United States House Committee on Oversight and Accountability")
 on July 22; she stepped down the following day.[\[18\]](#cite_note-19)
[\[19\]](#cite_note-20)
 President [Joe Biden](/wiki/Joe_Biden "Joe Biden")
 ordered an independent review of the security arrangements,[\[20\]](#cite_note-21)
 condemned the violence, and called for a reduction in heated political rhetoric, emphasizing the importance of resolving political differences peacefully.[\[21\]](#cite_note-Schneider-2024-22)
 Misinformation and [conspiracy theories](/wiki/Conspiracy_theories_in_United_States_politics "Conspiracy theories in United States politics")
 spread on social media after the shooting.[\[22\]](#cite_note-Spring-2024-23)
 Lawmakers called for increased security for major candidates in the election,[\[23\]](#cite_note-24)
 and the Secret Service subsequently approved enhanced security measures, including the use of [bulletproof glass](/wiki/Bulletproof_glass "Bulletproof glass")
 at Trump's outdoor rallies.[\[24\]](#cite_note-25)

Background
----------

At the time of the incident, Donald Trump was the presumptive Republican [nominee](/wiki/Presidential_nominee "Presidential nominee")
 in the [2024 presidential election](/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election "2024 United States presidential election")
.[\[25\]](#cite_note-26)
 The shooting occurred two days before the [2024 Republican National Convention](/wiki/2024_Republican_National_Convention "2024 Republican National Convention")
 in [Milwaukee](/wiki/Milwaukee "Milwaukee")
, Wisconsin.[\[26\]](#cite_note-Salant-2024-27)
 A previous attempt at violence toward Trump during one of his rallies happened in 2016, when a man attempted to grab a police officer's gun at a [rally outside of Las Vegas](/wiki/2016_Donald_Trump_Las_Vegas_rally_incident "2016 Donald Trump Las Vegas rally incident")
.[\[27\]](#cite_note-28)

On July 3, 2024,[\[28\]](#cite_note-29)
 the [Trump campaign](/wiki/Donald_Trump_2024_presidential_campaign "Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign")
 announced that Trump would hold a rally on July 13 at the Butler Farm Show Grounds in [Connoquenessing Township](/wiki/Connoquenessing_Township "Connoquenessing Township")
 and [Meridian](/wiki/Meridian,_Pennsylvania "Meridian, Pennsylvania")
, near [Butler, Pennsylvania](/wiki/Butler,_Pennsylvania "Butler, Pennsylvania")
.[\[29\]](#cite_note-30)
 On July 10, an advance team began setting up for the rally, including the installation of generators in a large open field.[\[30\]](#cite_note-31)
 The rally was part of the campaign's attempts to garner votes in [Pennsylvania](/wiki/Pennsylvania "Pennsylvania")
, a [swing state](/wiki/Swing_state "Swing state")
[\[31\]](#cite_note-32)
 with 19 votes in the [Electoral College](/wiki/United_States_Electoral_College "United States Electoral College")
.[\[26\]](#cite_note-Salant-2024-27)
 [Dave McCormick](/wiki/Dave_McCormick "Dave McCormick")
, the Republican nominee in the [state's concurrent U.S. | [\[109\]](#cite_note-DuBois-110)<br>[\[114\]](#cite_note-Trump_returns_to_NJ_after_assassination_attempt-2024-115) |

Victims
-------

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/Former_President_Donald_Trump_paying_respect_to_Corey_Comperatore_%2853887491621%29.jpg/250px-Former_President_Donald_Trump_paying_respect_to_Corey_Comperatore_%2853887491621%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Former_President_Donald_Trump_paying_respect_to_Corey_Comperatore_(53887491621).jpg)

Trump standing alongside Corey Comperatore's fire department uniform while delivering his July 18 acceptance speech at the [2024 Republican National Convention](/wiki/2024_Republican_National_Convention "2024 Republican National Convention")

Corey Comperatore of [Sarver, Pennsylvania](/wiki/Sarver,_Pennsylvania "Sarver, Pennsylvania")
, was killed by gunfire.[\[2\]](#cite_note-The_New_York_Times-2024-3)
 Comperatore, aged 50, worked as a project and [tooling engineer](/wiki/Tool_engineering "Tool engineering")
 and was the former chief of the [Buffalo Township](/wiki/Buffalo_Township,_Butler_County,_Pennsylvania "Buffalo Township, Butler County, Pennsylvania")
 Volunteer Fire Company.[\[115\]](#cite_note-Fenton-2024-116)
[\[116\]](#cite_note-117)
[\[117\]](#cite_note-Esposito-2024-118)
 According to Comperatore's family and Pennsylvania governor [Josh Shapiro](/wiki/Josh_Shapiro "Josh Shapiro")
, he died while shielding his wife and two daughters from gunfire.[\[117\]](#cite_note-Esposito-2024-118)
[\[118\]](#cite_note-119)
 In addition to Trump, a number of other people were injured.[\[119\]](#cite_note-120)
 Two other male audience members, aged 57 and 74, were shot and critically injured.[\[120\]](#cite_note-121)
[\[121\]](#cite_note-122)
[\[122\]](#cite_note-123)
 Both victims were listed as being in stable condition the following day.[\[123\]](#cite_note-124)
 The 57-year-old victim was discharged from the hospital on July 24;[\[124\]](#cite_note-125)
 the 74-year-old was discharged on July 26.[\[125\]](#cite_note-126)

U.S. This image was part of [a series of photographs](/wiki/Donald_Trump_raised-fist_photographs "Donald Trump raised-fist photographs")<br> by the photojournalist [Evan Vucci](/wiki/Evan_Vucci "Evan Vucci")<br> that were widely circulated after the attempt.[\[229\]](#cite_note-230)<br>[\[230\]](#cite_note-231) |     |

The photojournalist [Evan Vucci](/wiki/Evan_Vucci "Evan Vucci")
 of the [Associated Press](/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press")
 captured widely praised images of a bloodied Trump pumping his fist in the air, surrounded by Secret Service members, with an American flag in the background.[\[231\]](#cite_note-232)
 The photos quickly spread on social media and television and were widely circulated by Trump's allies, including the [National Republican Senatorial Committee](/wiki/National_Republican_Senatorial_Committee "National Republican Senatorial Committee")
, family members, and Republican members of Congress.[\[232\]](#cite_note-233)
[\[233\]](#cite_note-234)
 The images were seen as encapsulating strength, resilience, patriotism, Donald Trump himself, the United States, as well as the ongoing [culture war](/wiki/Culture_war "Culture war")
 in the country.[\[234\]](#cite_note-235)
[\[235\]](#cite_note-236)
[\[236\]](#cite_note-237)
[\[237\]](#cite_note-238)

Also widely reproduced and discussed was an image by _New York Times_ photographer [Doug Mills](/wiki/Doug_Mills_(photographer) "Doug Mills (photographer)")
 apparently showing a bullet passing Trump.[\[238\]](#cite_note-Ismay-2024-239)
[\[239\]](#cite_note-Parkes-Hupton-2024-240)
[\[240\]](#cite_note-241)
 Journalists compared this image to other iconic photographs capturing singular events in American history and remarked on the improbability of capturing a bullet speeding past the subject of an attempted assassination. president or presidential candidate since [Ronald Reagan](/wiki/Ronald_Reagan "Ronald Reagan")
 was [shot in 1981](/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Ronald_Reagan "Attempted assassination of Ronald Reagan")
.[\[80\]](#cite_note-Carr_Smyth-2024-81)
[\[243\]](#cite_note-244)
 Political scientists,[\[244\]](#cite_note-245)
[\[245\]](#cite_note-Baker-2024-246)
 historians,[\[246\]](#cite_note-247)
[\[245\]](#cite_note-Baker-2024-246)
 and many Democratic and Republican political figures[\[247\]](#cite_note-248)
 pointed to the shooting as a consequence of [political polarization in the United States](/wiki/Political_polarization_in_the_United_States "Political polarization in the United States")
.[\[248\]](#cite_note-249)
 The shooting led to widespread sympathy for Trump on social media,[\[249\]](#cite_note-250)
 and public figures across the political spectrum both domestically and internationally[\[250\]](#cite_note-Timsit-2024-251)
 urged a decrease in tensions, condemning the assassination attempt.[\[245\]](#cite_note-Baker-2024-246)
[\[251\]](#cite_note-252)

Journalist [Salena Zito](/wiki/Salena_Zito "Salena Zito")
, who was present at the event, published a book, _Butler: The Untold Story of the Near Assassination of Donald Trump and the Fight for America's Heartland_, in 2025.[\[252\]](#cite_note-253)
 It debuted as a #1 on [_The New York Times_ Best Seller list](/wiki/The_New_York_Times_Best_Seller_list "The New York Times Best Seller list")
.[\[253\]](#cite_note-254)

### Domestic

U.S. This was spurred by the fact that Crooks had appeared in a BlackRock advertisement in 2022, which had been filmed at his high school.[\[343\]](#cite_note-344)
    [\[344\]](#cite_note-Dunn-2024-345)
     In less than a day, a tweet revealing Crooks's appearance in the advertisement video was viewed more than 17 million times.[\[344\]](#cite_note-Dunn-2024-345)
     The video was then removed by the company.[\[345\]](#cite_note-346)
     The conspiracy theory that some people had foreknowledge is based on the fact that on July 12, 2024, one day before the assassination attempt, the investment company Austin Private Wealth filed a report with the [Securities and Exchange Commission](/wiki/Securities_and_Exchange_Commission "Securities and Exchange Commission")
     indicating that it had [shorted](/wiki/Shorted "Shorted")
     12 million shares of [Trump Media & Technology Group](/wiki/Trump_Media_%26_Technology_Group "Trump Media & Technology Group")
     (ticker symbol DJT), thus betting that the value of the stock would decrease.[\[346\]](#cite_note-Frank_Chung-2024-347)
     Four days later, the filing was amended to 1,200 shares, and the company apologized for what it asserted was a "filing error".[\[346\]](#cite_note-Frank_Chung-2024-347)
    

In an interview with [Fox News](/wiki/Fox_News "Fox News")
 on April 9, 2025, former Secret Service special agent Richard Staropoli stated that he believed that the assassination attempt, as well as [the one in Florida two months later](/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Florida "Attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Florida")
, was part of a [conspiracy](/wiki/Conspiracy "Conspiracy")
."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Wikipedia and discusses the attempted assassination of Donald Trump on July 13, 2024, in Pennsylvania. The perpetrator, Thomas Matthew Crooks, shot Trump with an AR-15-style rifle. Crooks killed one audience member and injured others. The article mentions increased security for Trump due to intelligence indicating Iran was plotting to assassinate him. The article also mentions conspiracy theories and misinformation that spread after the shooting. The article does not mention any Jewish Americans or Israel's involvement. <image:i>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department): 
Content: "Accessibility links

*   [Skip to main content](#mainContent)
    
*   [Keyboard shortcuts for audio player](https://help.npr.org/contact/s/article?name=what-are-the-keyboard-shortcuts-for-using-the-npr-org-audio-player)
    

**DOJ brings charges in Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Trump** **Federal prosecutors charged a man who said he had been tasked by a contact in Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard with planning the assassination of the Republican president-elect.**

### [Politics](https://www.npr.org/sections/politics/)

DOJ brings charges in an alleged Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Trump
===========================================================================

  

November 8, 20247:01 PM ET

By 

[The Associated Press](https://www.npr.org/people/101453150/the-associated-press)

  !Former President Donald Trump is reflected in the bullet proof glass as he finishes speaking at a campaign rally in Lititz, Pa., on Nov. **Matt Rourke/AP** ****hide caption****

****toggle caption****

Matt Rourke/AP

WASHINGTON — The Justice Department on Friday disclosed an Iranian murder-for-hire plot to kill Donald Trump, charging a man who said he had been tasked by a government official before this week's election with planning the assassination of the Republican president-elect.

Investigators were told of the plan to kill Trump by Farhad Shakeri, an accused Iranian government asset who spent time in American prisons for robbery and who authorities say maintains a network of criminal associates enlisted by Tehran for surveillance and murder-for-hire plots.

### [National Security](https://www.npr.org/sections/national-security/)

### [Listen: DOJ announces charges against Afghan national allegedly hired by Iran to kill Trump](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184427/doj-announces-charges-against-afghan-national-allegedly-hired-by-iran-to-kill-trump)

Shakeri told the FBI that a contact in Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard instructed him this past September to set aside other work he was doing and assemble a plan within seven days to surveil and ultimately kill Trump, according to a criminal complaint unsealed in federal court in Manhattan.

The official was quoted by Shakeri as saying that “We have already spent a lot of money" and that “money’s not an issue.” Shakeri told investigators the official told him that if he could not put together a plan within the seven-day timeframe, then the plot would be paused until after the election because the official assumed Trump would lose and that it would be easier to kill him then, the complaint said.

Shakeri is at large and remains in Iran. Qassem Soleimani, an act that prompted Iran’s leaders to vow revenge.

Trump spokesman Steven Cheung said the president-elect was aware of the assassination plot and nothing will deter him “from returning to the White House and restoring peace around the world.”

*   [Donal Trump](https://www.npr.org/tags/561172861/donal-trump)
    
*   [2024 election](https://www.npr.org/tags/1112328830/2024-election)
    
*   [Iran](https://www.npr.org/tags/126916110/iran)
    
*   [Justice Department](https://www.npr.org/tags/126936119/justice-department)
    

*   **Facebook**
*   **Flipboard**
*   **Email** <image:11240>](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/g-s1-33274/2024-election-how-trump-won-takeaways)

### [Elections](https://www.npr.org/sections/elections/)

### [Why Trump won — 9 takeaways from the 2024 election](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/g-s1-33274/2024-election-how-trump-won-takeaways)

The criminal complaint says Shakeri disclosed some of the details of the alleged plots in a series of recorded telephone interviews with FBI agents while in Iran. <image:11236>

Former President Donald Trump is reflected in the bullet proof glass as he finishes speaking at a campaign rally in Lititz, Pa., on Nov. Officials say he overlapped with Rivera while in prison as well as an unidentified co-conspirator.

[!Former President Donald Trump arrives to speak during an election night event in West Palm Beach, Fla., in the early morning hours on Wednesday. The stated reason for his cooperation, he told investigators, was to try to get a reduced prison sentence for an associate behind bars in the U.S.

According to the complaint, though officials determined that some of the information he provided was false, his statements regarding a plot to kill Trump and Iran's willingness to pay large sums of money were determined to be accurate.

The plot, announced by the Justice Department just days after Trump's defeat of Democrat Kamala Harris, is part of what federal officials have described as ongoing efforts by Iran to target U.S. <image:11241>](https://www.npr.org/2024/09/27/g-s1-25020/trump-campaign-hack-iran-election)

### [National Security](https://www.npr.org/sections/national-security/)

### [Trump campaign hack traced to three Iranians seeking to disrupt election, DOJ says](https://www.npr.org/2024/09/27/g-s1-25020/trump-campaign-hack-iran-election)

Iranian operatives also conducted a hack-and-leak operation of emails belonging to Trump campaign associates in what officials have assessed was an effort to interfere in the presidential election and harm Trump's campaign.

Intelligence officials have said Iran opposed Trump’s reelection, seeing him as more likely to increase tension between Washington and Tehran. Two other men were arrested on charges that Shakeri recruited them to follow and kill prominent Iranian-American journalist Masih Alinejad, who has endured multiple Iranian murder-for-hire plots foiled by law enforcement.

“I’m very shocked,” said Alinejad, speaking by telephone to The Associated Press from Berlin, where she was about to attend a ceremony to mark the anniversary of the tearing down of the wall. as a child but was later deported after spending 14 years in prison for robbery, also told investigators that he was tasked by his Revolutionary Guard contact with plotting the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York and Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
NPR reports on a Justice Department announcement of an Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Donald Trump. The plot was allegedly orchestrated by an Iranian government official. The article mentions Farhad Shakeri, an Iranian government asset, who was tasked with planning the assassination. The article also mentions that Shakeri was tasked with plotting the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York and Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka. The article was published on November 8, 2024. <image:11240>, <image:11236>, <image:11241>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump): 
Content: "[](#maincontent)

DOJ announces charges in Iranian plot to kill Donald Trump
==========================================================

CNN  — 

The Justice Department on Friday announced federal charges in a thwarted Iranian plot to kill [Donald Trump](https://www.cnn.com/politics/president-donald-trump-45)
 before the presidential election.

According to court documents, Iranian officials asked Farhad Shakeri, 51, in September to focus on surveilling and ultimately assassinating Trump. Shakeri is still at large in Iran, the Justice Department said.

This is a newly disclosed plot and marks [yet another alleged](https://www.cnn.com/2024/08/06/politics/iran-trump-assassination-charges/index.html)
 attempt on Trump’s life by the Iranian regime.

Prosecutors allege Shakeri – who participated in recorded conversations with law enforcement – was originally tasked by Iran’s Revolutionary Guard Corps to carrying out other assassinations against US and Israeli citizens inside the US. “The Justice Department has charged an asset of the Iranian regime who was tasked by the regime to direct a network of criminal associates to further Iran’s assassination plots against its targets, including President-elect Donald Trump.”

Iran has “categorically dismissed” the Justice Department’s allegation.

The Foreign Ministry, posting on social media platform X on Saturday, described the claims as “completely baseless and rejected,” adding that “similar accusations have been made in the past,” which Iran has “firmly denied and proven false.” The claims amount to a “malicious conspiracy” aimed at “further complicating the issues between the US and Iran,” the ministry said.

The US government has repeatedly raised concerns that Iran may try to retaliate for a 2020 US [drone strike](https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/03/asia/soleimani-profile-intl-hnk/index.html)
 that killed [Gen. Iranian-American journalist and political activist Masih Alinejad [confirmed Friday](https://x.com/AlinejadMasih/status/1854959153770643838)
 that she was one of the victims targeted.

Alinejad has been the [target of several assassination plots](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/22/politics/iranian-revolutionary-guards-assassination-plot/index.html)
, according to the Justice Department.

The two defendants allegedly monitored Alinejad at a speaking event earlier this year, as well as at her home in New York.

In one voice memo between the defendants, Rivera told the others, “This b\*tch is hard to catch, bro. Shakeri also said he was tasked with surveilling and assassinating two individuals described only as Jewish businesspeople living in New York City.

_This story has been updated with additional details._

_Correction: An earlier version of this story stated that all three men were specifically charged in the plot against Donald Trump._

CNN’s Sandi Sidhu and Edward Szekeres contributed to this report.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
CNN published an article on November 8, 2024, reporting that the Justice Department announced charges in a thwarted Iranian plot to kill Donald Trump before the presidential election. The article states that Iranian officials tasked Farhad Shakeri with surveilling and assassinating Trump. Shakeri was also tasked with surveilling and assassinating two Jewish businesspeople in New York City. <image:i>

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "The assassination plot to kill Donald Trump in 2024 was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans. Israel wants war with Iran but wants American money to fund it and American servicemen to fight it."

## Actions
```
web_search("assassination plot Donald Trump 2024")
web_search("Israel Iran war US involvement")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania): 
Content: The search result is from Wikipedia and discusses the attempted assassination of Donald Trump on July 13, 2024, in Pennsylvania. The perpetrator, Thomas Matthew Crooks, shot Trump with an AR-15-style rifle. Crooks killed one audience member and injured others. The article mentions increased security for Trump due to intelligence indicating Iran was plotting to assassinate him. The article also mentions conspiracy theories and misinformation that spread after the shooting. The article does not mention any Jewish Americans or Israel's involvement. <image:i>


From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department): 
Content: NPR reports on a Justice Department announcement of an Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Donald Trump. The plot was allegedly orchestrated by an Iranian government official. The article mentions Farhad Shakeri, an Iranian government asset, who was tasked with planning the assassination. The article also mentions that Shakeri was tasked with plotting the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York and Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka. The article was published on November 8, 2024. <image:11240>, <image:11236>, <image:11241>


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump): 
Content: CNN published an article on November 8, 2024, reporting that the Justice Department announced charges in a thwarted Iranian plot to kill Donald Trump before the presidential election. The article states that Iranian officials tasked Farhad Shakeri with surveilling and assassinating Trump. Shakeri was also tasked with surveilling and assassinating two Jewish businesspeople in New York City. <image:i>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
One source discusses an attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Pennsylvania on July 13, 2024, by Thomas Matthew Crooks, who shot Trump with an AR-15-style rifle. The article mentions increased security for Trump due to intelligence indicating Iran was plotting to assassinate him. The article does not mention any Jewish Americans or Israel's involvement. [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania) <image:i>

NPR and CNN report on a Justice Department announcement of an Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Donald Trump, orchestrated by an Iranian government official, Farhad Shakeri. Shakeri was tasked with planning the assassination of Trump and the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York. [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump) <image:11240>, <image:11236>, <image:11241>, <image:i>

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/what-to-know-about-the-u-s-militarys-intervention-in-the-israel-iran-war): 
Content: "forces, while Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu praised Trump’s decision to attack.

Iran’s response
---------------

Iran launched a barrage of missiles against Israel overnight and into Sunday, with Israeli authorities reporting that more than 80 people were wounded, the vast majority of them lightly.

Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said the time for diplomacy had passed and his country had the right to defend itself.

“The warmongering, a lawless administration in Washington is solely and fully responsible for the dangerous consequences and far-reaching implications of its act of aggression,” he said in a news conference in Istanbul. Kallas will chair a meeting of the 27-nation bloc’s foreign ministers in Brussels on Monday, with the Israel-Iran war high on the agenda.

Iranian-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen, who had threatened to resume attacks on U.S. vessels in the Red Sea if the Trump administration joined Israel’s military campaign, called on other Muslim nations to form “one front against the Zionist-American arrogance.”

Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei had warned the U.S. military’s intervention in the Israel-Iran war
==========================================================================

[World](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world)
 Jun 22, 2025 11:33 AM EDT

ATHENS, Greece (AP) — The United States inserted itself into Israel’s war against Iran, bombing three of the Islamic Republic’s key nuclear sites overnight in an attack it dubbed “Operation Midnight Hammer.” U.S. The war so far has killed hundreds of people and wounded more than 1,000 in Iran and killed two dozen and wounded hundreds in Israel.

Iran insists its nuclear program is only for peaceful purposes. intelligence agencies have assessed that Tehran is not actively pursuing a bomb, Trump and Israeli leaders have argued it could quickly assemble a nuclear weapon, making it an imminent threat.

The region has been on edge for the past two years as Israel seeks to annihilate the Hamas militant group, an Iranian ally, in the Gaza Strip, where war still rages after Hamas’ Oct. on Wednesday that strikes against Iran would “result in irreparable damage for them.”

The Israeli military said Saturday it was preparing for the possibility of a lengthy war, while Iran’s foreign minister warned before the U.S. President Trump meets Israeli PM Netanyahu in Washington <image:11244>

By —

[Elena Becatoros, Associated Press](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/author/elena-becatoros-associated-press)

What to know about the U.S. President Donald Trump asserted that the sites were “completely and fully obliterated,” and warned there would be additional strikes if Iran retaliates.

The U.S."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
PBS NewsHour reports on the U.S. military's intervention in the Israel-Iran war. The article mentions that the U.S. bombed Iranian nuclear sites and that the war has resulted in casualties in both Iran and Israel. The article also includes a photograph of Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu <image:11244>. The article was published on June 22, 2025, and was written by Elena Becatoros, Associated Press.

Claim: "The assassination plot to kill Donald Trump in 2024 was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans. Israel wants war with Iran but wants American money to fund it and American servicemen to fight it."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war): 
Content: "The IDF announced that the missiles were intercepted, with at least 50 rockets downed.[\[220\]](#cite_note-235)
 In the evening, Iran fired several barrages of missiles at Israel, injuring seven people in Haifa and one in [Kiryat Gat](/wiki/Kiryat_Gat "Kiryat Gat")
, and causing fires and property damage.[\[221\]](#cite_note-236)

A strike was reported on the [Ministry of Justice](/wiki/Ministry_of_Justice_(Iran) "Ministry of Justice (Iran)")
 building in Tehran and the IAF said that it bombed a [refueling plane](/wiki/Aerial_refueling "Aerial refueling")
 at the [Mashhad Shahid Hasheminejad International Airport](/wiki/Mashhad_Shahid_Hasheminejad_International_Airport "Mashhad Shahid Hasheminejad International Airport")
 in what was possibly the most distant operation in its history.[\[222\]](#cite_note-237)
[\[223\]](#cite_note-238)
 Israel also struck surface-to-surface missiles in Iran as well as military bases and the Iranian foreign ministry.[\[224\]](#cite_note-CNNLive20250615-239)
 Missiles struck and killed the intelligence chief and the intelligence deputy chief of the IRGC.[\[225\]](#cite_note-IRGC_KILLED-240)
 Along with the airstrikes, five car bombs detonated across Tehran, with explosions taking place next to government and nuclear-related sites and killing several nuclear scientists.[\[226\]](#cite_note-241)
[\[227\]](#cite_note-242)
 and an Israeli official denied any involvement.[\[228\]](#cite_note-243)
 The IDF otherwise warned Iranian civilians to evacuate from the areas surrounding weapon factories and military bases in Shiraz.[\[229\]](#cite_note-244)
[\[230\]](#cite_note-245)

In July 2025, Iranian president [Masoud Pezeshkian](/wiki/Masoud_Pezeshkian "Masoud Pezeshkian")
 accused [Israel of attempting to assassinate him](/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Masoud_Pezeshkian "Attempted assassination of Masoud Pezeshkian")
,[\[231\]](#cite_note-246)
 with an Iranian official saying that Pezeshkian sustained light injuries to his leg following an airstrike targeting a meeting of the [Supreme National Security Council](/wiki/Supreme_National_Security_Council "Supreme National Security Council")
 in Tehran on 15 June, but was able to escape along with other officials through a pre-designated emergency hatch. Trump rejected Russian President [Vladimir Putin](/wiki/Vladimir_Putin "Vladimir Putin")
's offer to mediate a ceasefire in the Iran–Israel war,[\[561\]](#cite_note-577)
 telling him to focus on mediating a ceasefire in the [Russo-Ukrainian War](/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_War "Russo-Ukrainian War")
.[\[562\]](#cite_note-France_24-Iran–Israel_war-578)

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Graph_US_population_on_conflict_with_Iran.png/250px-Graph_US_population_on_conflict_with_Iran.png)](/wiki/File:Graph_US_population_on_conflict_with_Iran.png)

Opinion polling of Americans on US involvement in the Iran-Israel war[\[563\]](#cite_note-Survey250623-579)

Opinion polling on Americans on US involvement in the war by [YouGov](/wiki/YouGov "YouGov")
 found 85% of those surveyed were opposed to the war, while 5% supported and 10% were unsure of it.[\[563\]](#cite_note-Survey250623-579)

The British Foreign Secretary declared that the Islamic Republic is the greatest threat to global security.[\[564\]](#cite_note-580)
 Following the US strikes on Iran, Russia and China stated that the conflict risked [globalization](/wiki/World_war "World war")
.[\[565\]](#cite_note-581)
 Former Russian president [Dmitry Medvedev](/wiki/Dmitry_Medvedev "Dmitry Medvedev")
 proposed that [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan "Pakistan")
 and Russia could give Iran nuclear warheads in response to the war.[\[566\]](#cite_note-BusinessInsider20250623-582)
[\[567\]](#cite_note-583)
 China also stated that the US attacks would further destabilize the region.[\[568\]](#cite_note-584)
[\[566\]](#cite_note-BusinessInsider20250623-582)

In a televised address that day, Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu declared a "historic victory", stating that Israel had "removed two immediate existential threats", referring to Iran's nuclear program and its ballistic missile arsenal.[\[569\]](#cite_note-585)
 Reports from the Institute for the Study of War and [American Enterprise Institute](/wiki/American_Enterprise_Institute "American Enterprise Institute")
 revealed that moderate clerics and political elites were urging a ceasefire and even considering sidelining Khamenei if he did not accept.[\[436\]](#cite_note-ISW24June-452)
 Iranian state television and pro-government outlets highlighted widespread public relief and celebratory mood across Tehran and other cities, depicting the ceasefire as an Iranian success and a signal of regional strength.[\[570\]](#cite_note-586)
[\[571\]](#cite_note-587)
[\[572\]](#cite_note-588)
 According to _[The Economist](/wiki/The_Economist "The Economist")
_, Israel has achieved a level of military dominance in the region that may surpass previous high points, including the aftermath of the 1967 [Six-Day War](/wiki/Six-Day_War "Six-Day War")
.[\[573\]](#cite_note-589)

In a prerecorded address released on 26 June, Khamenei warned the United States against future attacks.[\[574\]](#cite_note-590)
 On 27 June, Iran accused [Azerbaijan](/wiki/Azerbaijan "Azerbaijan")
 of allowing Israel to use its territory for drone attacks on Iran, a claim that Azerbaijan then rejected.[\[575\]](#cite_note-591)

Misinformation
--------------

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/AI-Generated_Destroyed_Israeli_jet.jpg/250px-AI-Generated_Destroyed_Israeli_jet.jpg)](/wiki/File:AI-Generated_Destroyed_Israeli_jet.jpg)

A commonly shared fake AI generated image that reportedly shows a damaged Israeli jet.[\[576\]](#cite_note-BBC-disinformation-592)

During the conflict, there were widespread psychological warfare and misinformation campaigns by both Israel and Iran. **[^](#cite_ref-364)
    ** ["Iran FM warns US involvement in conflict would be 'very dangerous' as Israel targets commanders"](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/ckg3rzj8emjt?post=asset%3Aff086260-071d-4f85-9a98-b42ef3b73d19#post)
    . _The Guardian_.

| 1990s | *   **[Gulf War (1990–1991)](/wiki/Gulf_War "Gulf War")<br>    **<br>*   [1991 Iraqi uprisings](/wiki/1991_Iraqi_uprisings "1991 Iraqi uprisings")<br>    <br>*   [Terror campaign in Egypt (1990s)](/wiki/Terrorism_in_Egypt "Terrorism in Egypt")<br>    <br>*   [Yemeni civil war (1994)](/wiki/Yemeni_civil_war_(1994) "Yemeni civil war (1994)")<br>    <br>*   [Iraqi Kurdish Civil War](/wiki/Iraqi_Kurdish_Civil_War "Iraqi Kurdish Civil War")<br>    <br>*   [_Islamic insurgency in Saudi Arabia (2000–present)_](/wiki/Terrorism_in_Saudi_Arabia "Terrorism in Saudi Arabia")<br>    <br>*   [Operation Desert Fox](/wiki/1998_bombing_of_Iraq "1998 bombing of Iraq")<br>    <br>*   [al-Qaeda insurgency in Yemen](/wiki/Al-Qaeda_insurgency_in_Yemen "Al-Qaeda insurgency in Yemen")<br>    <br>*   [1999 Shia uprising in Iraq](/wiki/1999_Shia_uprising_in_Iraq "1999 Shia uprising in Iraq") |
| 2000s | *   **[Iraq War](/wiki/Iraq_War "Iraq War")<br>    **<br>*   _[Balochi insurgency in Iran](/wiki/Sistan_and_Baluchestan_insurgency "Sistan and Baluchestan insurgency")<br>    _<br>*   [2004 Qamishli riots](/wiki/2004_Qamishli_riots "2004 Qamishli riots")<br>    <br>*   [Houthi insurgency in Yemen](/wiki/Houthi_insurgency_in_Yemen "Houthi insurgency in Yemen")<br>    <br>*   _[Iran–Israel proxy conflict](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_proxy_conflict "Iran–Israel proxy conflict")<br>    _<br>    *   [2006 Lebanon War](/wiki/2006_Lebanon_War "2006 Lebanon War")<br>        <br>*   [Fatah–Hamas conflict](/wiki/Fatah%E2%80%93Hamas_conflict "Fatah–Hamas conflict")<br>    <br>*   [South Yemen insurgency](/wiki/South_Yemen_insurgency "South Yemen insurgency") |
| 2010s | *   [2011 Bahraini uprising](/wiki/2011_Bahraini_uprising "2011 Bahraini uprising")<br>    <br>*   [Egyptian Crisis](/wiki/Egyptian_Crisis_(2011%E2%80%932014) "Egyptian Crisis (2011–2014)")<br>    *   [Sinai insurgency](/wiki/Sinai_insurgency "Sinai insurgency")<br>        <br>    *   _[Insurgency in Egypt (2013–present)](/wiki/Timeline_of_terrorism_in_Egypt_(2013%E2%80%93present) "Timeline of terrorism in Egypt (2013–present)")<br>        _<br>*   _**[Syrian civil war](/wiki/Syrian_civil_war "Syrian civil war")<br>    **_<br>    *   _[Turkish involvement in Syria](/wiki/Turkish_involvement_in_the_Syrian_civil_war "Turkish involvement in the Syrian civil war")<br>        _<br>*   [Syrian War spillover in Lebanon](/wiki/Syrian_civil_war_spillover_in_Lebanon "Syrian civil war spillover in Lebanon")<br>    <br>*   [Iraqi insurgency (2011–2013)](/wiki/Iraqi_insurgency_(2011%E2%80%932013) "Iraqi insurgency (2011–2013)")<br>    <br>*   **[War in Iraq (2013–2017)](/wiki/War_in_Iraq_(2013%E2%80%932017) "War in Iraq (2013–2017)")<br>    **<br>*   _[Islamic State insurgency in Iraq (2017–present)](/wiki/Islamic_State_insurgency_in_Iraq_(2017%E2%80%93present) "Islamic State insurgency in Iraq (2017–present)")<br>    _<br>*   [Yemeni crisis](/wiki/Yemeni_crisis "Yemeni crisis")<br>    *   _**[Yemeni civil war (2014–present)](/wiki/Yemeni_civil_war_(2014%E2%80%93present) "Yemeni civil war (2014–present)")<br>        **_ |

Iran–Israel warPart of the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")
 and [Iran–Israel proxy war](/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_proxy_war "Iran–Israel proxy war")

From top to bottom, left to right:

*   Israeli jets on their way to attack Iran
*   [U.S. Air Force")
     [B-2 Spirit](/wiki/B-2_Spirit "B-2 Spirit")
     being prepared for [American strikes on Iran](/wiki/United_States_strikes_on_Iranian_nuclear_sites "United States strikes on Iranian nuclear sites")
    
*   Israeli strike on the [IRIB](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran_Broadcasting "Islamic Republic of Iran Broadcasting")
     studio
*   explosions in Tehran during the war
*   Iranian target interceptions over Tehran
*   debris in [Bat Yam](/wiki/Bat_Yam "Bat Yam")
     following an Iranian strike

Casualties and losses**Per Israel:**  
31 civilians and 1 off-duty soldier killed[\[d\]](#cite_note-12)
[\[e\]](#cite_note-14)
  
3,238 wounded[\[10\]](#cite_note-israelcasualties-15)
  
2 [Hermes drones](/wiki/Elbit_Hermes_900 "Elbit Hermes 900")
 shot down[\[11\]](#cite_note-hermesdowned-16)
  
**Per Iran:**  
61+ [UAVs](/wiki/Unmanned_Aerial_Vehicles "Unmanned Aerial Vehicles")
 and [cruise missiles](/wiki/Cruise_missiles "Cruise missiles")
 destroyed[\[12\]](#cite_note-17)
  
10,000+ drones seized[\[13\]](#cite_note-18)
[\[14\]](#cite_note-AVA25June-19)
  
700+ Mossad agents arrested[\[14\]](#cite_note-AVA25June-19)
  
5 Mossad agents executed[\[f\]](#cite_note-23)
**Per Iran:**  
1,060 killed[\[18\]](#cite_note-24)
[\[19\]](#cite_note-25)
 (including ~140 women and children[\[20\]](#cite_note-Iran_casualties-26)
)  
5,800 wounded[\[20\]](#cite_note-Iran_casualties-26)
  
**Per [HRANA](/wiki/HRANA "HRANA")
:**  
436 civillians, 435 military personnel, and 319 unidentified deaths[\[21\]](#cite_note-HRANA-27)
  
4,475 injured[\[21\]](#cite_note-HRANA-27)
  
**Per Israel:**  
950 drones destroyed before being launched[\[22\]](#cite_note-28)
  
200+ [ballistic missile](/wiki/Ballistic_missile "Ballistic missile")
 launchers and 120+ [SAM](/wiki/Surface-to-air_missile "Surface-to-air missile")
 launchers destroyed[\[23\]](#cite_note-29)
[\[24\]](#cite_note-thirtypercent-30)
  
8 [AH-1](/wiki/Bell_AH-1_SuperCobra "Bell AH-1 SuperCobra")
 helicopters destroyed[\[25\]](#cite_note-31)
[\[26\]](#cite_note-32)
  
5 [F-14](/wiki/Grumman_F-14_Tomcat "Grumman F-14 Tomcat")
 fighter jets destroyed[\[27\]](#cite_note-TWZTomcats-33)
[\[28\]](#cite_note-34)
  
2 [F-5](/wiki/Northrop_F-5 "Northrop F-5")
 fighter jets destroyed[\[29\]](#cite_note-35)
  
1 [KC-707](/wiki/Boeing_707 "Boeing 707")
 refueling aircraft destroyed[\[30\]](#cite_note-36)
Reports vary widely, see [Casualties](/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war "Casualties of the Iran–Israel war")
 for details. 
Tens of thousands of Iranian civilians displaced[\[31\]](#cite_note-iran-displacement-37)
  
9,000+ Israeli civilians displaced[\[32\]](#cite_note-38)
[\[33\]](#cite_note-39)
[\[34\]](#cite_note-40)
  
8,000+ Israeli civilians homeless[\[35\]](#cite_note-41)

The **Iran–Israel war**, also known as the **Twelve-Day War** (13 June – 24 June 2025), was an [armed conflict](/wiki/Armed_conflict "Armed conflict")
 in the [Middle East](/wiki/Middle_East "Middle East")
 fought during June 2025, in the midst of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
 and its [broader regional spillover](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")
."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from Wikipedia and discusses the Iran-Israel war, which took place from June 13–24, 2025. It mentions the involvement of the United States and includes images of the conflict <image:k>. The result also includes information about casualties, attacks, and a ceasefire.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

President Trump announced a ceasefire after Iran launched an attack at a US base in Qatar Monday, which it sent warning of in advance.

Israel and Iran traded missile strikes Tuesday, accusing one another of breaking the ceasefire, before each side recommitted to it.

Marc Volovici, a 42-year-old historian, told Reuters in Haifa that the US involvement in the conflict underscored Israel’s dependence on its key ally.

“It’s just a demonstration that Israel, even though it claims to be in charge of its own fate and future, is still dependent on American support completely in terms of both political and financial backing and, of course, ammunition.”

Link Copied!

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked US President Donald Trump for the United States’ involvement in the Iran-Israel conflict.

In an address to the nation Tuesday night, the prime minister expressed gratitude to Trump for “his coordination and joining the campaign, not just on the defensive, but also offensively,” calling it a “historic event.”

“We have never had a greater friend in the White House,” he said of Trump.

Netanyahu said that just hours before the ceasefire, Israel carried out the most “devastating” strike Tehran has seen in 50 years.

“We eliminated hundreds of regime operatives and members of the Revolutionary Guard,” he said.

Israel “destroyed” Iran’s nuclear program, Netanyahu said, warning if anyone in Iran tries to restore the program, Israel will “act with the same determination and the same force to foil such an attempt.”

**Remember:** Trump flashed intense anger this morning, criticizing both sides, but reserving his [harshest condemnation for Israel,](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-conflict-us-trump-06-24-25-intl-hnk#cmcaf5mst00003b6prm250209)
 who he said “unloaded” on Iran “as soon as we made the deal.” While Netanyahu thanked Trump, the president’s decision to launch airstrikes against Iran is broadly unpopular with Americans, [according to a new CNN poll](https://www.cnn.com/2025/06/24/politics/trump-iran-strikes-poll-cnn-ssrs)
.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed Israel will continue to weaken what he called the “Iranian axis,” defeat Hamas and secure the return of hostages in Gaza.

'They don't know what the f\*\*k they're doing': Trump lashes out at Israel and Iran

02:25 \- Source: [CNN](https://www.cnn.com/)

'They don't know what the f\*\*k they're doing': Trump lashes out at Israel and Iran

02:25

**• Early intel assessment:** The US military’s strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program and likely [only set it back by months](https://www.cnn.com/2025/06/24/politics/intel-assessment-us-strikes-iran-nuclear-sites)
, according to an early US intelligence assessment that was described by sources briefed on it. The White House acknowledged the existence of the assessment but said it disagreed with it.

**• Trump’s rebuke:** US President Donald Trump [flashed intense anger this morning](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-conflict-us-trump-06-24-25-intl-hnk#cmcaf5mst00003b6prm250209)
 as the ceasefire he brokered between Israel and Iran appeared to grow more fragile. Before heading to the [NATO summit](https://www.cnn.com/2025/06/24/politics/nato-summit-trump-solitary-approach)
 in the Netherlands, Trump conveyed he was particularly unhappy with Israel.

**• Ceasefire appears to hold:** Both Israel and Iran said they will not break the ceasefire unless the other does so first, after the two countries earlier traded accusations of truce violations. Trump also said he [does not seek regime change in Iran](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-conflict-us-trump-06-24-25-intl-hnk#cmcakn6wq00003b6rnk2xjmfm)
 because he doesn’t want to see “chaos.”

Israelis on the streets of Haifa Tuesday afternoon welcomed a tentative end to their country’s 12-day conflict with Iran and expressed some gratitude to US President Donald Trump for his role in the currently holding ceasefire.

Interviews conducted in the northern city by the Reuters news agency came just hours after Trump used a profanity to lash out at Israel, accusing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, and Iran, of breaching the ceasefire he had announced.

“Yes, that’s typical Trump,” a 70-year-old Haifa resident, who gave her name as Esther, told Reuters.

Haifa has been the target of Iranian missiles since Israel’s initial strikes on June 13, including an attack that injured dozens on Saturday.

Daniel Kopylkov, a 27-year-old cook, told Reuters: “Honestly, I don’t care that much about what Trump said about Israel.

The US struck three Iranian nuclear facilities on Saturday, in attacks the White House said “obliterated” Tehran’s nuclear program. local time, before deleting and reposting after correcting a spelling error in the original post, slamming CNN and The New York Times, for what he called “AN ATTEMPT TO DEMEAN” the strikes.

Yuki Iwamura/AP

Danny Danon, Israel’s ambassador to the United Nations, said his country would respond “forcefully” to any violation of the ceasefire that has been struck with Iran.

Speaking to the UN Security Council on Tuesday, Danon echoed other Israeli officials in thanking US President Donald Trump for his role in the ceasefire he announced on Monday.

He reiterated that Israel “struck a severe blow” to Iran with its attacks on Iranian regime targets.

![Iran's Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations Amir-Saeid Iravani speaks during a Security Council meeting at the United Nations Headquarters on Tuesday.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/ap25175764653114.jpg?c=original&q=w_1280,c_fill/f_avif)

Iran's Ambassador and Permanent Representative to the United Nations Amir-Saeid Iravani speaks during a Security Council meeting at the United Nations Headquarters on Tuesday.

Yuki Iwamura/AP

Iran’s United Nations envoy Amir-Saeid Iravani thanked Qatar for its role in the Iran-Israel ceasefire at a UN Security Council meeting Tuesday.

“I wish to sincerely thank our brotherly and friendly nation the state of Qatar for its sincere and diplomatic efforts to help end Israeli aggression, establish a ceasefire and prevent a further escalation of regional tensions that threaten peace and stability in the region,” the Iranian diplomat told the council.

Iravani’s expression of gratitude to Qatar comes a day after Iran launched an attack on a US airbase in the Gulf country.

Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman bin Jassim Al-Thani [secured Iran’s agreement](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2025%2F06%2F24%2Fmiddleeast%2Fmiddle-east-situation-tuesday-intl-hnk&data=05%7C02%7CTori.Powell%40cnn.com%7Cd7a84f9f5b2a47085c3e08ddb363ef96%7C0eb48825e8714459bc72d0ecd68f1f39%7C0%7C0%7C638863964156994783%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=fOAEsZHZY%2BUv04iGzABqZOlMnJRXy1LW0yJovJ8POyY%3D&reserved=0)

From [Source](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/what-to-know-about-the-u-s-militarys-intervention-in-the-israel-iran-war): 
Content: PBS NewsHour reports on the U.S. military's intervention in the Israel-Iran war. The article mentions that the U.S. bombed Iranian nuclear sites and that the war has resulted in casualties in both Iran and Israel. The article also includes a photograph of Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu <image:11244>. The article was published on June 22, 2025, and was written by Elena Becatoros, Associated Press.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Israel_war): 
Content: The search result is from Wikipedia and discusses the Iran-Israel war, which took place from June 13–24, 2025. It mentions the involvement of the United States and includes images of the conflict <image:k>. The result also includes information about casualties, attacks, and a ceasefire.


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-conflict-us-trump-06-24-25-intl-hnk): 
Content: The CNN article, updated June 25, 2025, discusses the conflict between Israel and Iran, including US involvement and President Trump's role. <image:i>. The article mentions a ceasefire brokered by Trump, with both sides accusing each other of violations. It also includes statements from Israeli and Iranian officials, as well as reactions from the public. The article also mentions that the US military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program. The article also mentions that Trump lashed out at Israel.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The PBS NewsHour article discusses the U.S. military's intervention in the Israel-Iran war, mentioning U.S. bombings of Iranian nuclear sites and casualties in both countries. The article includes a photograph of Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu <image:11244>. The Wikipedia article discusses the Iran-Israel war, which took place from June 13–24, 2025, and mentions the involvement of the United States, including images of the conflict <image:k>. The article mentions a ceasefire brokered by Trump, with both sides accusing each other of violations.

The CNN article also mentions that the US military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program. The article also mentions that Trump lashed out at Israel.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "The assassination plot to kill Donald Trump in 2024 was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans. Israel wants war with Iran but wants American money to fund it and American servicemen to fight it."

## Actions
```
web_search("assassination plot Donald Trump 2024")
web_search("Israel Iran war US involvement")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
One source discusses an attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Pennsylvania on July 13, 2024, by Thomas Matthew Crooks, who shot Trump with an AR-15-style rifle. The article mentions increased security for Trump due to intelligence indicating Iran was plotting to assassinate him. The article does not mention any Jewish Americans or Israel's involvement. [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania) <image:i>

NPR and CNN report on a Justice Department announcement of an Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Donald Trump, orchestrated by an Iranian government official, Farhad Shakeri. Shakeri was tasked with planning the assassination of Trump and the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York. [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump) <image:11240>, <image:11236>, <image:11241>, <image:i>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The PBS NewsHour article discusses the U.S. military's intervention in the Israel-Iran war, mentioning U.S. bombings of Iranian nuclear sites and casualties in both countries. The article includes a photograph of Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu <image:11244>. The Wikipedia article discusses the Iran-Israel war, which took place from June 13–24, 2025, and mentions the involvement of the United States, including images of the conflict <image:k>. The CNN article discusses the conflict between Israel and Iran, including US involvement and President Trump's role <image:i>. The article mentions a ceasefire brokered by Trump, with both sides accusing each other of violations.

The CNN article also mentions that the US military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program. The article also mentions that Trump lashed out at Israel.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim that the assassination plot was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans is false. Evidence indicates that the plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official.

The claim that Israel wants war with Iran and wants American money and servicemen is partially supported. Evidence shows the US military's involvement in the Israel-Iran war, including bombings of Iranian nuclear sites. The evidence also shows that the US was involved in brokering a ceasefire.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "The assassination plot to kill Donald Trump in 2024 was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans. Israel wants war with Iran but wants American money to fund it and American servicemen to fight it."

## Actions
```
web_search("assassination plot Donald Trump 2024")
web_search("Israel Iran war US involvement")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
One source discusses an attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Pennsylvania on July 13, 2024, by Thomas Matthew Crooks, who shot Trump with an AR-15-style rifle. The article mentions increased security for Trump due to intelligence indicating Iran was plotting to assassinate him. The article does not mention any Jewish Americans or Israel's involvement. [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Pennsylvania) <image:i>

NPR and CNN report on a Justice Department announcement of an Iranian murder-for-hire plot against Donald Trump, orchestrated by an Iranian government official, Farhad Shakeri. Shakeri was tasked with planning the assassination of Trump and the killings of two Jewish-Americans living in New York. [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department), [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump) <image:11240>, <image:11236>, <image:11241>, <image:i>


### Evidence from `web_search`
The PBS NewsHour article discusses the U.S. military's intervention in the Israel-Iran war, mentioning U.S. bombings of Iranian nuclear sites and casualties in both countries. The article includes a photograph of Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu <image:11244>. The Wikipedia article discusses the Iran-Israel war, which took place from June 13–24, 2025, and mentions the involvement of the United States, including images of the conflict <image:k>. The CNN article discusses the conflict between Israel and Iran, including US involvement and President Trump's role <image:i>. The article mentions a ceasefire brokered by Trump, with both sides accusing each other of violations.

The CNN article also mentions that the US military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program. The article also mentions that Trump lashed out at Israel.


## Elaboration
The claim that the assassination plot was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans is false. Evidence indicates that the plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official.

The claim that Israel wants war with Iran and wants American money and servicemen is partially supported. Evidence shows the US military's involvement in the Israel-Iran war, including bombings of Iranian nuclear sites. The evidence also shows that the US was involved in brokering a ceasefire.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the assassination plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official, not Jewish Americans, making the first part of the claim false. The second part of the claim, regarding Israel's desire for war and American involvement, is partially supported by evidence of US military involvement in the conflict.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

The CNN article also mentions that the US military strikes on three of Iran’s nuclear facilities over the weekend did not destroy the core components of its nuclear program. The article also mentions that Trump lashed out at Israel.


## Elaboration
The claim that the assassination plot was orchestrated by two Jewish Americans is false. Evidence indicates that the plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official.

The claim that Israel wants war with Iran and wants American money and servicemen is partially supported. Evidence shows the US military's involvement in the Israel-Iran war, including bombings of Iranian nuclear sites. The evidence also shows that the US was involved in brokering a ceasefire.


## Final Judgement
The evidence indicates that the assassination plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official, not Jewish Americans, making the first part of the claim false. The second part of the claim, regarding Israel's desire for war and American involvement, is partially supported by evidence of US military involvement in the conflict.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. Evidence indicates that the assassination plot was orchestrated by an Iranian government official, not Jewish Americans, as reported by [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2024/11/08/nx-s1-5184549/iran-donald-trump-murder-for-hire-plot-justice-department) and [CNN](https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/08/politics/doj-charges-three-iranian-plot-to-kill-donald-trump). The second part of the claim is partially supported by evidence of US military involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict, as discussed by [PBS NewsHour](https://www.pbs.org/newshour/world/u-s-military-strikes-iranian-nuclear-sites-in-israel-iran-war).

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Donald Trump stated on October 7, 2024 in an interview with Hugh Hewitt: Of Gaza, 'I’ve been there.'"

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Donald Trump Hugh Hewitt interview October 7 2024 Gaza")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Donald Trump stated on October 7, 2024 in an interview with Hugh Hewitt: Of Gaza, 'I’ve been there.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Hugh Hewitt interview October 7 2024 Gaza")
```

Ex-President Trump Misstates Gaza Visit in Hugh Hewitt Interview
================================================================

Steven Ganot

10/09/2024

[](https://themedialine.org/mideast-daily-news/ex-president-trump-misstates-gaza-visit-in-hugh-hewitt-interview/print/ "Print This Post")

Former President Donald J. Trump’s strong support for Israel has been central to his campaign, highlighting past achievements like relocating the US Embassy to Jerusalem, recognizing Israeli sovereignty on the Golan Heights, and brokering the Abraham Accords, but polls show that reoccupation of the Gaza Strip would be a far less popular policy among Israelis and American supporters of the Jewish state.

In the interview, Hewitt asked Trump if Gaza could be transformed into a prosperous area like Monaco. The remark came during a conversation with conservative host Hugh Hewitt on Monday, which marked the anniversary of the October 7 attacks by Hamas. Trump, the Republican nominee in this year’s US presidential election, claimed in a recent radio interview that he had visited Gaza, a war-torn region he has never officially been recorded visiting. When asked for clarification, a campaign aide asserted that Gaza is “in Israel” and noted that Trump had visited Israel.

The Gaza Strip, under Hamas control since 2007, is not claimed by Israel, though it was under Israeli military administration from 1967 to 2005. You know when—I’ve been there, and it’s rough.”

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Media Line published an article on October 9, 2024, stating that Donald Trump misstated a Gaza visit in an interview with Hugh Hewitt. The article also mentions that Trump visited Israel and the West Bank in 2017 but did not visit Gaza. <image:11498>, <image:11499>.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/8/trump-claims-he-visited-gaza-but-theres-no-evidence-he): 
Content: "![Gaze destruction](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/2024-10-07T092442Z_177567009_RC2LFAAJU2T3_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-1728413294.jpg?resize=770%2C513&quality=80)

Palestinians walk past the rubble of houses destroyed in Israel's military offensive in Khan Younis in the southern <span>Gaza Strip</span>, October 7, 2024 \[Mohammed Salem/Reuters\]

Published On 8 Oct 20248 Oct 2024

Former President Donald Trump claimed in a radio interview that he has been to Gaza even though no record of such a visit exists.

The comment, which Trump made in an interview with conservative radio host [Hugh Hewitt](https://hughhewitt.com/former-president-trump-on-the-anniversary-of-the-10-7-massacre-in-israel)
 that was broadcast on Monday, came in response to a question about whether the occupied territory, which Israel has largely razed to the ground over the last year, could be developed to “be Monaco, if it was rebuilt the right way?”

-------------------

### [Photos: Protesters demand US ends support for Israel’s war on Gaza, Lebanon](/gallery/2024/9/25/protesters-demand-us-ends-support-for-israels-war-on-gaza)

end of list

“It could be better than Monaco. President Trump has been to Israel.”

Gaza is not, nor has it ever been “in Israel.” The Palestinian territory has been [illegally occupied by Israel](/news/2023/11/8/qa-former-un-expert-stresses-israels-occupation-of-gaza-never-ended)
, as well as the West Bank and East Jerusalem, since 1967.

Israel withdrew its army and settlers from Gaza in 2005, under a policy that the Israeli government at the time dubbed “disengagement.” But Israel remains an occupying power in Gaza under international law, as its military continues to retain effective control of its borders, airspace and coastline.

The Israeli military has invaded the territory again for the last year following the October 7 attacks by Hamas.

Although false claims are not uncommon from Trump, it was unclear if these were deliberate lies or whether they just revealed his lack of knowledge about the region’s geography.

[Trump visited Israel](/news/2017/5/23/donald-trump-ends-middle-east-tour)
 and the occupied West Bank in 2017, his first year in office, and met Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas at the time. It’s a rough place, before the, you know, before all of the attacks and before the back and forth what’s happened over the last couple of years.”

Asked to clarify, a spokesperson for the Trump campaign told the [New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/07/us/politics/trump-gaza-israel.html)
 that “Gaza is in Israel. Kushner had called Gaza’s waterfront property “very valuable.”

In the interview with Hewitt, Trump also referenced Gaza’s oceanfront location.

“They never took advantage of it,” he said. The West Bank and Gaza are separate occupied territories, only reachable to each other by travelling through Israel — something most Palestinians are not allowed to do.

Trump’s comments about Gaza echoed those made by his son-in-law and former adviser [Jared Kushner](/program/newsfeed/2024/3/20/former-trump-official-calls-gazas-waterfront-property-very)
 earlier this year. It has the best location in the Middle East, the best water, the best everything,” Trump responded."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
Al Jazeera published an article on October 8, 2024, stating that Donald Trump claimed in an interview with Hugh Hewitt on October 7, 2024, that he had been to Gaza, despite no record of such a visit. <image:1>. The article mentions Trump's comments about Gaza's potential and its oceanfront location.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "Donald Trump stated on October 7, 2024 in an interview with Hugh Hewitt: Of Gaza, 'I’ve been there.'"

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Hugh Hewitt interview October 7 2024 Gaza")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://rollcall.com/factbase/trump/transcript/donald-trump-interview-hugh-hewitt-radio-october-7-2024): 
Content: The search result is a transcript of an interview between Hugh Hewitt and Donald Trump on October 7, 2024. At 00:06:21-00:06:31, Hewitt asks Trump if he would applaud if Israel hits their nuclear sites.
